revised_title: Transcription Factors: TFIID and the Mechanisms of Transcriptional Activation and Repression
tldr: This article discusses the role of TFIID, specifically TATA-binding protein (TBP) and associated factors (TAFs), in both transcriptional activation and repression. The author presents experiments that support the idea that TBP recruitment to a promoter can activate expression, and provides further evidence that the transcriptional repressor Even-skipped interacts with TBP. This highlights the importance of TBP in both activation and repression mechanisms in gene regulation.
